summary_points: 1. Domino's Pizza Inc. reported a 5.1% year-over-year revenue increase to $4.71 billion in fiscal year 2024, driven by higher supply chain, royalty, and advertising revenues.
2.  The company faces a potential additional 5% annual interest expense on $1.14 billion in debt due in 2025 if refinancing is unsuccessful.

3. A failed sale-leaseback transaction in 2023 resulted in a $119.5 million increase in Domino's long-term debt obligations, and the company has an additional $178 million in estimated future minimum rental commitments.

1. On February 24, 2025, Baker Hughes appointed Ahmed Moghal as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, replacing Nancy Buese, who will transition to an advisory role until April 30, 2025.
2.  Mr. Moghal's compensation includes a $750,000 base salary, a target bonus of 100% of base salary, and a "top-up" equity award with a grant date value of $2,155,000.
3. Ms. Buese's separation agreement includes a lump-sum cash payment equal to 12 months of her base salary and 12 months of outplacement services.
1. Leidos Holdings, Inc. announced on February 24, 2025, an accelerated share repurchase agreement to buy back $500 million of its common stock.
2.  As part of this agreement, Leidos Holdings made an initial payment of $500 million on February 20, 2025, and received approximately 3 million shares.
3. Final settlement of the share repurchase is expected in the second quarter of 2025, but could be completed earlier.
1. As of February 21, 2025, News Corporation repurchased approximately US$639,941,091.85 worth of Class A and Class B shares under its US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2.  On February 21, 2025, 21,041,298 Class A shares and 10,380,886 Class B shares were repurchased at a highest price of US$30.69 and US$35.25 respectively.
3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, announced September 22, 2021, aims to enhance shareholder value and may continue until a total of US$1 billion is spent.

1. On February 22, 2025, American Water Works Company, Inc. agreed to a separation from service with Melanie M. Kennedy, its Executive Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer, effective March 1, 2025.
2.  The filing is an 8-K current report, indicating a significant event requiring immediate disclosure to the SEC.
3. Ms. Kennedy's separation will be subject to the company's Executive Severance Policy, the details of which are not specified in this filing.
1. Domino's Pizza Inc. reported fourth-quarter 2024 global retail sales growth (excluding foreign currency impact) of 4.4% and fiscal year 2024 growth of 5.9%, as of February 24, 2025.
2.  Diluted earnings per share increased by 9.2% year-over-year in the fourth quarter of 2024, reaching $4.89.
3. The Board of Directors approved a 15% increase in the quarterly dividend, to $1.74 per share, effective March 28, 2025.
